title: Parashurama
summary: Parashurama (Sanskrit: परशुराम, romanized: Parasurama, lit. 'Rama with an axe'), also referred to as Rama Jamadagnya, Rama Bhargava and Veerarama,[1] is the sixth incarnation among the Dashavatar of the God Vishnu in Hinduism. He is believed to be one of the Chiranjeevis (Long-Lived Ones Or Immortal Ones), who will appear at the end of the Kali Yuga to be the guru of Vishnu's tenth and last incarnation, Kalki. He carried a number of traits, which included aggression, warfare and valor; also, serenity, prudence and patience.
